properties.headline: Melbourne Cup Day - Tuesday 3 November - RANDWICK Anzac Pde, Alison Rd, High St approaching Royal Randwick Racecourse
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Randwick Race Day Special event clearways
arrangementAttachments.fileName: Randwick Race Course Everest Day 17 Oct.pdf
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Randwick Race Day Special event clearways

properties.otherAdvice:
Melbourne Cup Day at Royal Randwick Racecourse, first race from 11:55am. 

Traffic may be heavier on roads around the racecourse including Anzac Pde, Doncaster Ave, High St, Alison Rd and Darley Rd as event goers travel to and from the event.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect on sections of Darley Rd from 4am to 7pm, Ascot St from 8am to 7pm and High St from 3pm to 7pm.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, and apply even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones, and apply even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed call 132 701 to find its new location.

RANDWICK 

FROM 4AM TO 7PM

  • Darley Rd between Alison Rd and roundabout to Centennial Park (western side)

FROM 8AM TO 7PM

  • Ascot St between Doncaster Ave and the roundabout at the racecourse (both sides)

FROM 3PM TO 7PM

  • High St between the gate 2 entry to UNSW and Anzac Pde (southern side)
arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

roads.mainStreet: Anzac Pde, Alison Rd, High St

properties.headline: Remembrance Day - Wednesday 11 November - COONABARABRAN John Street at Dalgarno Street
properties.otherAdvice:
John St (Newell Hwy) will be closed in both directions between Edwards St and Essex St from approximately 10:50am to 11:10am to support a Remembrance Day event at the Clock Tower Memorial roundabout at Dalgarno St.

Other local roads which feed onto John St will also be closed and detours will be in place.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and follow the direction of traffic controllers.

properties.headline: Cycle Ride - Sunday 1 November - NEWCASTLE WEST TO LOVEDALE via Hannell St, Industrial Dr, Maitland Rd, New England Hwy, John Renshaw Dr, Cessnock Rd and Wine Country Dr
properties.otherAdvice:
Around 200 cyclists will take part in the annual 58km Harbour2Vine Cycle Classic Ride travelling from the Rydges in Newcastle West to the Crowne Plaze Hunter Valley in Lovedale. Cyclists will ride in groups of 50 starting between 7am and 8:15am. 

Cyclists will travel via Wharf Rd, Honeysuckle Dr, Hannell St, Industrial Dr, Maitland Rd, New England Hwy, John Renshaw Dr, Cessnock Rd and will finish on Wine Country Dr in Lovedale by 1:30pm. 

Motorists should be aware of the groups of cyclists along the route as they share roads throughout the event.

Motorists are also reminded when overtaking cyclists to leave a 1.5m distance on roads with speed limits over 60km/h and a 1m distance on roads 60km/h or under.

roads.mainStreet: via Hannell St, Industrial Dr, Maitland Rd, New England Hwy, John Renshaw Dr, Cessnock Rd and Wine Country Dr

properties.headline: Triathlon - Saturday 31 October and Sunday 1 November - HUSKISSON various roads incl Huskission Rd, Hawke St, Owen St, Woollamia Rd, Sydney St approaching White Sands Park
properties.otherAdvice:
The TriHusky triathlon will take place over the weekend around White Sands Park from 6am until 5pm on Saturday and 6am until 12:30pm on Sunday. 

Access to Huskisson and Vincentia will be affected during the weekend while roads are closed and the event is underway.

Saturday: 

  • Road closures will be in place from 6am until 8:30am on sections of Hawke St, Bowen St, Owen St, Sydney St, Park St and Huskisson Rd. Residential access will be maintained during the closures. 
  • Woollamia Rd will remain open. 
  • Access to Huskisson is via Woollamia Rd and access to Vincentia is via Jervis Bay Rd and Naval College Rd.

Sunday: 

  • Road closures will be in place from 6am to until 9am on sections of Hawke St, Owen St, Currambene St, Sydney St, Woollamia Rd, Seasongood Rd, Fairfax Rd and Knoll Pde. Residential access will be maintained during the closures.
  • Access to Huskisson and Vincentia is via Jervis Bay Rd. 

Motorists are advised allow extra travel time through the area over the weekend.
properties.displayName: Triathlon - Saturday 31 October and Sunday 1 November

roads.mainStreet: various roads incl Huskission Rd, Hawke St, Owen St, Woollamia Rd, Sydney St
